program.name: sudo
program.configure:
case "${SB_SYSTYPE}" in *-aix*) CC=xlc CFLAGS="-O2 -qmaxmem=-1 -qarch=com" ;; *-hpux11*) CC=cc CFLAGS="+O2 -Ae -z +ESlit +Onofltacc +DAportable \ +Oentrysched +Odataprefetch +Onolimit" ARGS="--with-pam" ;; *-hpux*) CC=cc CFLAGS="+O2 -Ae -z +ESlit +Onofltacc +DAportable \ +Oentrysched +Odataprefetch +Onolimit" ;; *-irix6*) CC=cc CFLAGS="-Wl,-woff,84 -Wl,-woff,85 -woff 1429 -O2" NROFF=awf ;; *-linux*) ARGS="--with-pam" ;; *-osf*) CC=cc CFLAGS="-O2 -msym -readonly_strings" ;; *-solaris2.[89]) CFLAGS="-O2 -mcpu=v8" ARGS="--with-pam" ;; *-solaris2.5.1*) CC=cc CFLAGS="-mr -Qn -xstrconst -xO2 -xtarget=generic" ;; *-solaris2*) CC=cc CFLAGS="-mr -Qn -xstrconst -xO2 -xtarget=generic" ARGS="--with-pam" ;; esac
rm -f config.cache CFLAGS="${CFLAGS:--O2}" NROFFPROG=${NROFF:-nroff} \ ./configure --with-CC="${CC:-gcc}" \ --disable-path-info --enable-shell-sets-home \ --enable-log-host --with-logfac=auth --with-env-editor \ --with-ignore-dot --without-lecture --with-logging=syslog \ --with-goodpri=notice --with-badpri=alert \ --disable-sia --disable-root-mailer --without-blibpath \ --sysconfdir="${SB_INSTALL_PREFIX}/etc" \ ${ARGS+${ARGS}} --prefix=${SB_INSTALL_PREFIX}

note.para: Sudo has been compiled without the --secure-path option. Therefore, by default, the $PATH variable of users running sudo is trusted. This can be overridden with the "secure_path" flag in the sudoers file.
The default location of the sudoers file is ${SB_INSTALL_PREFIX}/etc/sudoers. It has been marked as a configuration file and its contents will be preserved then sudo is upgraded.
PAM support is enabled on Solaris 2.6, 7, 8, 9/SPARC, and HP-UX 11.x, and Redhat Linux.
